metadata.title: CVE-2020-15666 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: When trying to load a non-video in an audio/video context the exact statuscode (200, 302, 404, 500, 412, 403, etc.) was disclosed via the MediaErrorMessage. This level of information leakage is inconsistent with thestandardized onerror/onsuccess disclosure and can lead to inferring loginstatus to services or device discovery on a local network among otherattacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 80 and Firefox for Android <80.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
